6872acd2-61dc-4364-b610-89a023f96b85.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a foundational knowledge of the MITRE ATT&CK Framework and how to apply it operationally. They have also been exposed to tools such as MITRE ATT&CK Navigator and MITRE CAR that can assist in operationalizing the MITRE ATT&CK Framework. Additionally, earners have acquired foundational knowledge in finding, creating, and testing security analytics.
6872acd2-61dc-4364-b610-89a023f96b85.name: Foundations of Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Foundations of Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK Training
Passed Foundations of Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK assessment with an 80% or higher.

f5fb804e-df9f-4fea-a936-563ba168a2c1.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a foundational knowledge of Purple Teaming Methodology. They have also demonstrated knowledge of the core concepts, processes, and artifacts underpinning the practice of Purple Teaming. Additionally, earners have acquired the knowledge needed to plan and execute a basic Purple Team Exercise.
f5fb804e-df9f-4fea-a936-563ba168a2c1.name: Foundations of Purple Teaming

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Introduction to Purple Teaming training
Passed Introduction to Purple Teaming assessment with an 80% or higher.

552d3df7-85c8-4207-b2b4-99b7e332f83f.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a foundational knowledge of Breach & Attack Simulation tools. They have also demonstrated knowledge of the pros and cons of different approaches taken by BAS vendors. Additionally, earners have acquired the knowledge needed to compose basic security testing plans for use with a Breach & Attack Simulation tool.
552d3df7-85c8-4207-b2b4-99b7e332f83f.name: Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation

badge_template_activities.title: This 2-hour session is a hands-on training program designed to introduce the capabilities and deployment options in a BAS (breach and attack simulation) platform. Students will learn and apply testing methodologies used to emulate adversarial techniques and measure the efficacy of various security control implementations and configurations. The course will also introduce advanced topics such as building a threat-informed defensive strategy and operationalizing the MITRE ATT&CK Framework.
The student has passed an assessment by 80% or greater on topics contained in the Foundations of Breach and Attack Simulation Course.

6cbad543-e4a0-48cb-acab-ec5990cb3c30.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a thorough understanding of the MITRE FIN6 Emulation Plans. Additionally, badge earners have demonstrated knowledge in using these emulation plans to test their security controls.
6cbad543-e4a0-48cb-acab-ec5990cb3c30.name: Introduction To FIN6 Emulation Plans

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Introduction to FIN6 Emulation Plans course.
Passed Introduction to FIN6 Emulation Plans course assessment with an 80% or higher.

8c8d4e4e-c440-4b3a-92f5-411b63f39d97.description: This training session introduces students to the MITRE Center for Threat-Informed Defense NIST SP 800-53 Control-to-ATT&CK Mapping Project and its products. Students will learn the background of the NIST framework, the project goals, and how to customize and utilize the products.
8c8d4e4e-c440-4b3a-92f5-411b63f39d97.name: Uniting Threat and Risk Management with NIST 800-53 and MITRE ATT&CK

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has taken and completed Uniting Threat and Risk Management with NIST 800-53 and MITRE ATT&CK
The badge earner has passed a final assessment test on Uniting Threat and Risk Management with NIST 800-53 and MITRE ATT&CK with at least an 80% or higher.

5f68934b-eabc-4bc6-a786-24b8502249f6.description: This course expands upon the key concepts taught in Foundations of MITRE ATT&CK, with a strong focus on the tools that have been developed to operationalize the MITRE ATT&CK Framework. In this training, students will deep dive into using the ATT&CK Navigator in hands-on lab activities while getting a complete walkthrough of all of the features ATT&CK Navigator has to offer.
5f68934b-eabc-4bc6-a786-24b8502249f6.name: Application of ATT&CK Navigator

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has taken and completed Application of ATT&CK Navigator.
The badge earner has passed a final assessment test on Application of ATT&CK Navigator with at least an 80% or higher.

a6b55c99-3805-480c-a5f8-44158480f0be.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated an understanding of the challenges facing cybersecurity leadership today. Additionally, they have developed an understanding of cybersecurity strategy and cyber resilience.
a6b55c99-3805-480c-a5f8-44158480f0be.name: Strategic Cybersecurity Management

badge_template_activities.title: In this one hour and fifteen-minute course, technology and security experts Dr. Art Langer and Robert Duncan will share insights on how to build, deliver and implement a cybersecurity strategy based on threat intelligence; obtain executive and board-level consensus around cybersecurity strategies; think like an adversary and develop a playbook for cyber readiness and resilience; and evolve the security leadership role from one perceived as technical to a business-facing, strategic role.

65ff25d0-7099-4282-948b-08ec8feadb3c.description: This course walks learners through the EASY Framework, a framework for improving or creating your threat intelligence program. In this course, Chris Cochran and Ronald Eddings present a simple way to avoid headaches and keep your threat intelligence program organized and relevant.
65ff25d0-7099-4282-948b-08ec8feadb3c.name: Introduction to EASY Framework for Threat Intelligence

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has attended and completed the Introduction to EASY Framework for Threat Intelligence course.
The badge earner has passed a final assessment test on the EASY Framework for Threat Intelligence with at least an 80% or higher.

4430b7de-0320-499e-bfbd-7cd31779ef8c.description: The holder of this badge has a detailed understanding of the Top ATT&CK Techniques tool released by MITRE Engenuity's Center for Threat-Informed Defense (CTID). They have also demonstrated applied knowledge by taking abstract security requirements and turning them into the top ATT&CK techniques the organization should protect and defend against.
4430b7de-0320-499e-bfbd-7cd31779ef8c.name: Top ATT&CK Techniques

badge_template_activities.title: Top ATT&CK Techniques is a 45-minute course in which students will examine the latest tool to help your enterprise with the ATT&CK framework. Students are introduced to the Top ATT&CK Techniques project from MITRE Engenuity's Center for Threat-Informed Defense. After the introduction, students will gain a deep understanding of how to use the calculator feature of the project to understand the top ATT&CK techniques they should be concerned about.

079ed6d0-beef-4406-9100-880dcb67e0e4.description: This training session introduces students to running an adversary emulation plan. Students will learn how to scope out an environment, define emulation plan objectives, and run the emulation plans. Students will follow along with the instructor to learn how to go through the process of manually running through the emulation plan for menuPass Phase 1.
079ed6d0-beef-4406-9100-880dcb67e0e4.name: menuPass Emulation Plan Execution

badge_template_activities.title: Foundations of Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK
The learner has completed a 1.5-hour virtual training session on how to read, understand, and execute the menuPass Emulation Plan released by MITRE Engenuity's Center for Threat Informed Defense.

The learner has passed a final assessment with a score of at least 80% that demonstrates their understanding of the tactics, techniques, and procedures used by menuPass as described in the menuPass emulation plan.

147a5198-b7b0-4b38-9a5f-a16dd48b2d5f.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated an intermediate knowledge of Purple Teaming Methodology. Building on top of the core knowledge established in Foundations of Purple teaming, students have spent time during classes running through hands-on planning exercises including threat alignment and threat emulation planning.
147a5198-b7b0-4b38-9a5f-a16dd48b2d5f.name: Intermediate Purple Teaming

badge_template_activities.title: This course delves deeper into concepts from Foundations of Purple Teaming, providing background and instruction on the key processes enabling sound threat intelligence integration and organizational threat alignment in support of Purple team exercises. Students will create threat models based on the business requirements and IT architecture of a fictional organization and, in doing so, derive the skills required to understand their own threat environment and prepare actionable plans.

This course delves deeper into concepts from Foundations of Purple Teaming, providing background and instruction on the key processes enabling sound threat intelligence integration and organizational threat alignment in support of Purple team exercises. Students will create emulation plans based on the business requirements and IT architecture of a fictional organization and, in doing so, derive the skills required to understand their own threat environment and prepare actionable plans.
Foundations of Purple Teaming
Foundations of Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK
Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation

2b0be975-3d55-474c-99b7-332a1bdfd5be.description: Earners of this badge have been instructed on the MITRE Engenuity Center for Threat-Informed Defense's ATT&CK Workbench tool. They have demonstrated knowledge in the installation, configuration, and basic usage of the ATT&CK Workbench tool.
2b0be975-3d55-474c-99b7-332a1bdfd5be.name: Extending ATT&CK with ATT&CK Workbench

badge_template_activities.title: Foundations of Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK

ATT&CK Workbench is an application, designed by the MITRE Engenuity Center for Threat-Informed Defense, that allows users to explore, create, annotate, and share extensions of the MITRE ATT&CK knowledge base. This course is a 1-hour experience that teaches students the core concepts of installing, configuring, and utilizing ATT&CK Workbench in your environment.

3f494da9-21b5-4ae6-94e6-f2089e8d4d86.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge in not only their understanding of the MITRE ATT&CK Framework but also how to implement this framework through the use of adversary emulation plans created by MITRE Engenuity's Center For Threat Informed Defense.
3f494da9-21b5-4ae6-94e6-f2089e8d4d86.name: Intermediate MITRE ATT&CK

badge_template_activities.title: Foundations of Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK
Foundations of Purple Teaming
Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation
Application of ATT&CK Navigator
Extending ATT&CK with ATT&CK Workbench
Top ATT&CK Techniques
Introduction To FIN6 Emulation Plans
menuPass Emulation Plan Execution
Uniting Threat and Risk Management with NIST 800-53 and MITRE ATT&CK

c912185c-2401-4c44-a558-77f2c9ddbd81.description: Earners of this badge have been instructed on the MITRE Engenuity Center for Threat-Informed Defense Security Stack Mappings for Microsoft Azure project. Additionally, they have demonstrated knowledge in how to create their own cloud control mappings and utilize the project to secure Microsoft Azure cloud environments with native security controls.
c912185c-2401-4c44-a558-77f2c9ddbd81.name: MITRE ATT&CK Security Stack Mappings: Azure

badge_template_activities.title: Foundations of Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK

This 1.5-hour course is designed to introduce you to the Cloud Control Mappings project released by MITRE Engenuity's Center for Threat-Informed Defense. In this course, you will get an overview of how to create cloud mappings along with a walkthrough of the cloud control mappings for Azure.

d9d2824b-7cbc-4b5c-8f30-fe43f67d60d2.description: Owners of this badge have demonstrated a thorough understanding of the MITRE ATT&CK to CVE Mapping project from the Center for Threat-Informed Defense. Additionally, they have obtained the skills to map a CVE to the MITRE ATT&CK framework using the methodologies discussed in the project.
d9d2824b-7cbc-4b5c-8f30-fe43f67d60d2.name: Mapping MITRE ATT&CK to CVE for Impact

badge_template_activities.title: In this 45-minute course students are introduced to the methodologies used to map the MITRE ATT&CK Framework to Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs). Students will be exposed to the CTID project that created these methodologies and all of the existing mappings that have been done as a part of this project.
Students must score 80% or better on the final assessment for the AttackIQ Academy Course Mapping MITRE ATT&CK to CVE for Impact.

00434899-09e0-4108-b6ba-4dc416f2e87e.description: The owner of this badge has demonstrated basic knowledge of how MITRE ATT&CK, Breach & Attack Simulation, and Purple Teaming fit into the process of planning, designing, implementing, and managing security architecture.
00434899-09e0-4108-b6ba-4dc416f2e87e.name: Threat-Informed Architecture

badge_template_activities.title: In this 45 minute course, students are provided a quick introduction to the SABSA architecture framework. Each phase of the framework is explored through the lens of threat-informed defense. We will discuss different tools, processes, and resources that can be used throughout your architecture in order to provide a threat-informed defense woven into the fabric of your design.
The student has to complete a final exam on threat-informed architecture, scoring an 80% or above.

df6f9781-1d93-4c43-9828-34cb1cadd818.description: The owner of this badge has demonstrated knowledge in utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK Framework to map to Amazon AWS Cloud security controls. They also have demonstrated a deep understanding of the Security Stack Mappings project created by MITRE Engenuity's Center for Threat-Informed Defense.
df6f9781-1d93-4c43-9828-34cb1cadd818.name: MITRE ATT&CK Security Stack Mappings: AWS

badge_template_activities.title: This one-hour training session teaches students to utilize the Security Stack Mappings project, created by the MITRE Engenuity’s Center for Threat-Informed Defense to better align their defenses for Amazon AWS cloud services. Students will practice navigating and leveraging this knowledge base of security controls capabilities in order to create and execute an emulation plan.
The student must complete an assessment relating to the information taught in the course and the practical use of the AWS Security Stack Mappings project with a score of 80% or higher.

92bf8ad1-6553-4ab6-938c-1df7bf064e22.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated an intermediate knowledge of Breach & Attack Simulation. Building on top of the core knowledge established in Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation, students have spent time during classes running through hands-on planning and implementation exercises with the AttackIQ Platform.
92bf8ad1-6553-4ab6-938c-1df7bf064e22.name: Intermediate Breach & Attack Simulation

badge_template_activities.title: This course brings together the fundamentals learned in Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation through real-world scenario-based hands-on labs. During this class, there will be a strong focus on designing and executing assessments designed to find security gaps.

This course brings together the fundamentals learned in Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation through real-world scenario-based hands-on labs. During this course, there will be a strong focus on designing and executing assessments designed to test your security controls.
Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation
Foundations of Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK
Foundations of Purple Teaming
Beyond Atomic Testing with Attack Flows

7d01965c-cfb4-4cb3-ba02-4be8f5b3a15f.description: In this 1.5 hour course, students are introduced to testing EDR or AI-based cybersecurity tools utilizing the AttackIQ Security Optimization Platform. This course teaches students why Attack Flows are important to this testing while giving you practical experience with a lab set in AttackIQ's Cyber Range.
7d01965c-cfb4-4cb3-ba02-4be8f5b3a15f.name: Beyond Atomic Testing with Attack Flows

badge_template_activities.title: Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation
The badge earner has taken and completed Beyond Atomic Testing with Attack Flows.
The badge earner has passed a final assessment test on Beyond Atomic Testing with Attack Flows with at least an 80% or higher.

d495ebb4-1fd4-46a4-98c4-51b9dff7fc96.description: The holder of this badge has demonstrated an understanding of the lastest ATT&CK Sightings report from MITRE Engenuity's Center for Threat-Informed Defense. They have demonstrated additional knowledge in how to prevent, detect, and test manually or with the AttackIQ platform for the top techniques disclosed in the report.
d495ebb4-1fd4-46a4-98c4-51b9dff7fc96.name: Delivering Value with the ATT&CK Sightings Report

badge_template_activities.title: In this 45 minute course, students will be introduced to the Center for Threat-Informed Defense's Sightings program. Students will learn what a sighting is, how it is reported, and what is done with the data. Following this program overview, students will review some of the most important information from the 2021 ATT&CK Sightings report including a dive into some of the top techniques reported. This course includes hands-on labs in the AttackIQ Cyber Range.
The student has passed a final assessment of their knowledge on the ATT&CK Sightings report and the top three techniques listed in the report with an 80% or better.

0da12cc4-870a-4b95-bac3-bcf1edeac5c6.description: The holder of this badge has demonstrated a basic knowledge of utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK framework to protect and defend against ransomware.
0da12cc4-870a-4b95-bac3-bcf1edeac5c6.name: Countering Ransomware with MITRE ATT&CK

badge_template_activities.title: This 1.5-hour course discusses why ransomware has become the weapon of choice, some of the challenges ransomware poses, how your organization can prepare for ransomware, and how you can operationalize MITRE ATT&CK by leveraging your people, processes, and security technologies. During the course, students will learn these concepts through lecture that is reinforced with learning activities.
The student must score 80% or higher in a final assessment covering MITRE ATT&CK, ransomware, threat emulation, and mitigation strategies.

8a74c014-35d6-44aa-8e7a-c7f01e512b90.description: The owner of this badge has demonstrated knowledge in designing emulation plans that focus on the most relevant threats to their organization's cyber security. They have an understanding of how to extrapolate a company mission to determine centers of gravity, critical vulnerabilities, courses of action, and emulation planning.
8a74c014-35d6-44aa-8e7a-c7f01e512b90.name: Academy Live: Building Threat-Informed Emulation Plans

badge_template_activities.title: This four-hour learning experience reviews aspects of threat-informed defense, MITRE ATT&CK, and Purple teaming before walking students through the process of taking a company mission and turning it into an emulation plan that can be used in purple teaming and breach and attack simulation.

48aa3803-0cc9-45c9-a599-007f4d0c1d5b.description: The owner of this badge has demonstrated knowledge in implementing the AttackIQ platform as part of a continuous security lifecycle. They understand the different levels of maturity for implementation and how to continuously update and report on their practice of continuous security optimization.
48aa3803-0cc9-45c9-a599-007f4d0c1d5b.name: AttackIQ Foundational Blueprints

badge_template_activities.title: In this 1 hour course, students will be introduced to the AttackIQ Foundational Blueprints - a well-researched and documented way to introduce security optimization into your organization. Academy guest instructors Chris Cochran and Ronald Eddings will walk the student through utilizing the security optimization lifecycle, in conjunction with the AttackIQ Platform, at three levels of maturity. Although this course is designed for AttackIQ customers, it can be taken by anyone.
Score 80% or higher on a final assessment based on the AttackIQ Foundational Blueprints.

648994b0-3215-4035-9b33-b31bdbcf889f.description: The holder of this badge has demonstrated an understanding of Attack Flows including what the Attack Flow program is, the benefits of the Attack Flow program, reading and interpreting Attack Flows and converting threat intelligence into Attack Flows.
648994b0-3215-4035-9b33-b31bdbcf889f.name: Attack Flows

badge_template_activities.title: Inspired by and with direct input from the MITRE Engenuity Center for Threat Informed Defense (CTID), Attack Flows are defined as "a machine-readable representation of sequences of adversary techniques used in an attack." These Attack Flows are designed to help executives, SOC managers, and defenders easily understand and share how attackers compose adversarial techniques using a series of visuals to represent the attack in a set of common nomenclature (e.g. the MITRE ATT&CK framework).

719db99f-f9fd-4d14-a702-43d8750db052.description: The owner of this badge has demonstrated a deep knowledge of how to implement the projects released by MITRE Engenuity's Center for Threat-Informed Defense (CTID). Additionally, the owner of this badge has certified their knowledge in many ways to utilize the MITRE ATT&CK Framework specifically including mapping ATT&CK to vulnerabilities, mapping ATT&CK to cloud controls, and the utilities and tools that extend MITRE ATT&CK.
719db99f-f9fd-4d14-a702-43d8750db052.name: Center for Threat-Informed Defense Research

badge_template_activities.title: Foundations of Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK
Extending ATT&CK with ATT&CK Workbench
MITRE ATT&CK Security Stack Mappings: AWS
MITRE ATT&CK Security Stack Mappings: Azure
Introduction To FIN6 Emulation Plans
menuPass Emulation Plan Execution
Uniting Threat and Risk Management with NIST 800-53 and MITRE ATT&CK
Mapping MITRE ATT&CK to CVE for Impact
Delivering Value with the ATT&CK Sightings Report

d298c454-7235-4106-b50f-050809d7890a.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated practical and applied knowledge of working with and demonstrating the AttackIQ platform.
d298c454-7235-4106-b50f-050809d7890a.name: AttackIQ Professional

badge_template_activities.title: Foundations of Operationalizing MITRE ATT&CK
Foundations of Purple Teaming
Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation
Beyond Atomic Testing with Attack Flows

The course "Assessment Design for Security Controls," brings together the fundamentals learned in Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation through real-world scenario-based hands-on labs. During this course, there will be a strong focus on designing and executing assessments in the AttackIQ Platform.

In the course "AttackIQ Engineer Essentials," Partner Sales Engineers are taught how to present the AttackIQ Architecture and Demonstrate the AttackIQ Platform. Additionally, engineers are walked through the process of scoping test point placement and scoping for the AttackIQ platform.
The earner must complete an assessment for each of these courses, scoring at least 80% or higher.

2c1bd41d-ef65-425b-a628-d17a99689fd2.description: The holder of this badge has knowledge of the micro-emulation plan project from MITRE’s CTID and its use in testing security controls, the difference between atomic testing and threat emulation, why micro-emulation plans focus on key attack techniques, and how to create and execute micro-emulation plans using the AttackIQ platform. They can also test for specific ATT&CK techniques with the micro emulation plans
2c1bd41d-ef65-425b-a628-d17a99689fd2.name: Validating Defenses Quickly with Micro Emulation Plans

badge_template_activities.title: The course covers topics such as Atomic testing, Threat emulation, Inter-Process Communication, Process Injection, Exploitation for Privilege Escalation, Access Token Manipulation, Lateral Tool Transfer, Remote System Discovery, and more. The course also covers micro-emulation plans such as Named Pipes, Windows Registry, and User Execution, and provides an understanding of how to test these micro-emulation plans to validate the security controls of an organization.
The holder of this badge has scored 80% or higher on a final exam evaluating their knowledge of the course material.

2e3fc311-3ffd-4062-a93e-9a6c02bc9b53.description: This badge holder has validated knowledge of security challenges and how continuous validation can help address them. They have a good understanding of the AttackIQ platform and its architecture and practical experience with the platform through hands-on labs. They also have knowledge of purple teaming and its role in automating security control testing and understand how AttackIQ can aid organizations in validating and improving their cyber readiness.
2e3fc311-3ffd-4062-a93e-9a6c02bc9b53.name: Continuous Security Validation Workshop

badge_template_activities.title: This 1.5-hour course provides an overview of the AttackIQ platform, focusing on hands-on experience. The course will cover organizations' security challenges and how continuous security validation can help address these challenges. The course will conclude with a discussion on how AttackIQ can help organizations validate and improve their cyber readiness.

aea192d8-0de0-4dcb-b81c-33ffedcf04c6.description: The owner of this badge has demonstrated commitment to advancing cybersecurity education and threat-informed defense by creating and instructing a course for AttackIQ Academy.
aea192d8-0de0-4dcb-b81c-33ffedcf04c6.name: AttackIQ Academy Certified Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: This course is specifically designed to teach new Academy instructors and content creators how to create their course following AttackIQ Academy processes. It will also provide an overview of the entire process of course creation so that the instructor/creator understands the level of effort involved upfront.
This project includes creating an AttackIQ Academy course from idea inception to presenting course material, to marketing a course after it has been released.

52303ba1-3b7f-4c05-88d9-c575f16b0b82.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated an intermediate knowledge of Breach & Attack Simulation. Building on top of the core knowledge established in Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation, students have spent time during classes running through hands-on planning and implementation exercises with the AttackIQ Platform.
52303ba1-3b7f-4c05-88d9-c575f16b0b82.name: Hands-On Bootcamp

badge_template_activities.title: This course brings together the fundamentals learned in Foundations of Breach & Attack Simulation through real-world scenario-based hands-on labs. During this class, there will be a strong focus on designing and executing assessments designed to find security gaps and test security controls.

bf2d3032-99a0-4735-b9e4-2d538a151ae4.description: The holder of this badge has completed AttackIQ Academy's 6-hour training on the MITRE ATT&CK Framework. They have demonstrated an understanding of Threat Informed Defense, the ATT&CK Framework, CTID Emulation Plans, ATT&CK Navigator, MITRE CAR, MITRE D3FEND, and analysis of security events through the lens and tools of MITRE ATT&CK. This badge is only available to Academy Live session attendees.
bf2d3032-99a0-4735-b9e4-2d538a151ae4.name: Academy Live - Mastering MITRE ATT&CK

badge_template_activities.title: In this live in-person course, students will be exposed to every aspect of the MITRE ATT&CK® framework, including the tools that interact with it and the projects built around it. Through hands-on labs and engaging lectures, students will learn more about topics like Threat-Informed Defense, Adversary Emulation, MITRE ATT&CK Mapping, Emulation Plans, ATT&CK Navigator, ATT&CK Workbench, CAR, D3FEND, and many other tools used to interact with the ATT&CK Framework.
